confession.seduction_date: during lifetime of mother-in-law, when husband had gone away
confession.seduction_context: Was miserable because her husband had gone away. Told Sorpy she could not go with him because she had a small child, but he told her to take the child with her.
sabbat_locations: Mortbieu (col de Mortbieu, 790 m., 9 km WNW from Taye)
sabbat_activities: eating black/dead meat (sheep brought by Jean Brice)
saying mass (Grand Colas of la Mouline was marlier, Brice replied and sang mass)
cooking (Royne des Riales of Ramonchamp was the cook)

witnesses.name: Bastien Houat
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, his late father had wanted to marry her

testimony.quarrel_subject: neighbors complained of quarrels and losses of animals

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 2 days after meeting Nicolas and Jean Colombain on road

testimony.quarrel_subject: sister Marie turned her away from veillée saying there was no more space

harms_alleged.attributed_to: not specified - did not want to suspect anyone

testimony.threat_quote: Jean said if they did not let him join in cooking apples he would bring hail on them; called 'dredard, dredard'
his mother told her she would repent; his sister Mongeotte threatened to bewitch her when they were guarding animals

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: immediately - became so ill she thought she would die

testimony.quarrel_subject: her son Jean quarrelled with son of accused, Claudon
testimony.threat_quote: Jean told him he would make him eat rotten meat and all his teeth would fall out

witnesses.name: Jean Venin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor - was taken to Arches 15 years earlier

testimony.quarrel_subject: refused to lend her a horse (10 years earlier), then refused loan of a fine mare (2 years later)
testimony.threat_quote: she said he was 'un pauvre homme' to refuse such a small thing

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: within 2 weeks became wild, then died soon after

witnesses.name: Estienne fils Jean Haxart
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor - heard stories from other children

testimony.quarrel_subject: quarrel with Jean when guarding animals a month earlier
testimony.threat_quote: threats to kill him and make teeth fall out; Jean said 'Tantedient, mon pere aura bien tost de vos bestes'

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: Jean said he had made him ill already - was true that a year earlier had been very ill for 2 days
since Easter - big wolf appeared and carried off goat

harms_alleged.attributed_to: possibly Mengeotte - but did not suspect her
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 2 weeks after daughter asked for milk

testimony.threat_quote: Jean said he wanted to kiss her, and when she refused said he kissed prettier ones at a place where he danced; threatened 'il les feroit mourir, que les dents et les cheveux leur tomberoient'
Jean made threat before wolf attack

testimony.quarrel_subject: his father caught her stealing wood from hedge 4 years earlier

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day sickened, dying 2 or 3 days after

testimony.quarrel_subject: caught her stealing wood from hedge and struck her with stick
asked why they were not taking accused to Arches along with Mengeotte Bourgman; accused replied angrily

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day two wolves attacked their bullock

testimony.quarrel_subject: husband had dispute with her after finding 2 of her cows in his field
found 2 of her cows in his field 3 years earlier

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: later became ill, could not eat, drink, or rest for a year
she had been in his house one morning, although no quarrel

timeline.subject: Mengeotte femme Nicolas Colombain
timeline.details: Substitut for prévôt at Arches asks for her arrest, since she is greatly feared. She had been thinking of flight over last 4 or 5 weeks.

timeline.subject: Mengeotte femme Nicolas Colombain
timeline.details: First interrogation - denied all charges except being beaten by Nicolas Barthelemin

timeline.subject: Mengeotte femme Nicolas Colombain
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; no serious reproaches except saying Jean Demenge had stolen cheeses

timeline.subject: Mengeotte femme Nicolas Colombain and Jean (son)
timeline.details: Confrontation with her son Jean and interrogation - after cleric remonstrated with her, confessed to being a witch

timeline.subject: Mengeotte femme Nicolas Colombain
timeline.details: Detailed interrogation about seduction, sabbat attendance, and accomplices

timeline.subject: Mengeotte femme Nicolas Colombain
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for death sentence, after she has been subjected to question ordinaire to confirm accusations

timeline.subject: Mengeotte femme Nicolas Colombain
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves further torture

timeline.subject: Mengeotte femme Nicolas Colombain
timeline.details: Court at Arches orders interrogation under torture

timeline.subject: Mengeotte femme Nicolas Colombain
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - given thumbscrews, then racked; lost consciousness so torture halted

torture.restrictions: torture was brought to a halt when she seemed to lose consciousness during racking

accomplices_named.name: late Marie Faurel
accomplices_named.context: Named during interrogation on August 12, 1624 after being given holy water

accomplices_named.name: Jeannon Garnise
accomplices_named.context: Named during interrogation on August 12, 1624 after being given holy water

accomplices_named.name: George Garnise
accomplices_named.context: Named at end of August 12 interrogation

accomplices_named.name: George Parmentier
accomplices_named.context: Named during August 19 interrogation as being at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Jean Brice
accomplices_named.context: Named during August 19 interrogation - was marlier when they said mass, replied and sang mass, brought dead sheep

accomplices_named.name: Grand Colas
accomplices_named.context: Named during August 19 interrogation as the marlier when they said mass

accomplices_named.name: Royne des Riales (Royne veuve Jean des Thiales)
accomplices_named.context: Named as the cook at sabbat; mentioned by witness Nicolas fils Demenge Lamouratte and by accused

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean (son of accused, age 12)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ne falloit rien dire qu'on le prendroit et luy presenteroit on du plain blanc pour luy faire dire quelque chose, mais qu'il ne falloit rien prendre, autrement qu'on les emmeneroit et que si il ne disoit rien on les lascheroit
notable_quotes.english: that he must say nothing, that they would take him and offer him white bread to make him say something, but that he must take nothing, otherwise they would take them away and that if he said nothing they would let them go
notable_quotes.context: Jean warning his daughter Claudine (age 10) while guarding animals; testimony from witness Bastien Houat

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine femme Delon Choffel (witness 15)
notable_quotes.french: et que quand il jectoit une pierre il la jecteroit bien au diable s'il vouloit et que c'estoit plus de cent lieu long
notable_quotes.english: and that when he threw a stone he would throw it to the devil if he wanted and that it was more than a hundred leagues long
notable_quotes.context: Hearsay about what Jean said about going to sabbat with his mother

notable_quotes.speaker: Remy Choffel's wife (witness 20)
notable_quotes.french: print resolution d'envoyer au divin, encore qu'il ait deffendu qu'on n'y allast; ou on dit qu'on scavoit bien celle qui l'avoit retourné lors qu'elle eschappa de ses mains
notable_quotes.english: resolved to send to the diviner, although he had forbidden her to go there; where they said they knew well who had turned it back when it escaped from his hands
notable_quotes.context: After the mare became wild and ran away, brought back by accused

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon fils Jean Demenge (witness 23, age 11)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il alloit au sabat avec sa mere, et que son pere alloit querir de l'argent en un prey dit menaprey dans des rochers sur un petit cheval noir, qui avoit de grandes aureilles, point de poil et qu'on ne pouvoit se bonnement tenir dessus, disant que sa mere disoit qu'il ne le falloit dire aux autres
notable_quotes.english: that he went to the sabbat with his mother, and that his father went to get money in a meadow called menaprey in the rocks on a little black horse, which had big ears, no hair and that one could not properly sit on it, saying that his mother said he should not tell others
notable_quotes.context: Jean's description of sabbat activities told to other boys a year earlier

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon fils Jean Demenge (witness 23)
notable_quotes.french: Tantedient, mon pere aura bien tost de vos bestes
notable_quotes.english: By God, my father will soon have some of your beasts
notable_quotes.context: Jean became angry with children guarding animals since Easter; a big wolf then appeared and carried off a goat

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeotte fille Nicolas Villaume (witness 25, age 13)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il en baisoit de plus belles en un lieu ou il dancoit menant le devant et le derrier, qu'ils entroient dans une maison toute de fer (feu?) ou tout brusloit, neanmoins ne sentoient aucune chaleur, de là entroient en une chambre ou on cuisoit de la chair et du milliot, puis en une autre ou il y avoit plusieurs grands hommes noirs qui dresssoient la table et dela en une autre, ou ils dansoient, que ses pere et mere et ses soeurs y estoient, que la chair qu'ils mangeoient n'estoit pas bonne ny bien cuitte
notable_quotes.english: that he kissed prettier ones in a place where he danced leading the front and back, that they entered a house all of iron (fire?) where everything burned, nevertheless they felt no heat, from there they entered a room where they cooked meat and millet, then into another where there were several big black men who set the table and from there into another, where they danced, that his father and mother and sisters were there, that the meat they ate was not good nor well cooked
notable_quotes.context: Jean's detailed description of the sabbat when he wanted to kiss Mongeotte and she refused

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeotte fille Nicolas Villaume (witness 25)
notable_quotes.french: hier estant par devant nous on luy avoit fait donner du pain blanc, de la chair et des pastenees et qu'on l'auroit voulu pendre avec une couroye de cuir pour luy faire dire quelque chose, mais qu'il n'avoit rien voulu dire et que pour ce subject son pere luy avoit promis une chausse et pourpoint pareille a ceux du fils du gruyer et qu'il avoit bien fait ce que sa mere luy avoit dit ayant rejecté tout ce qu'on luy donnoit, de peur de parler et que s'il parloit on le feroit pendre bien hault
notable_quotes.english: yesterday being before us they had given him white bread, meat and parsnips and that they would have wanted to hang him with a leather strap to make him say something, but that he had not wanted to say anything and that for this reason his father had promised him breeches and doublet like those of the gruyer's son and that he had done well what his mother had told him having rejected all that they gave him, for fear of speaking and that if he spoke they would hang him very high
notable_quotes.context: Jean told this to Mongeotte and her sister while guarding animals the morning after his interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Colombain (accused)
notable_quotes.french: Mon dieu! Que dois-je faire, jamais je n'ay faict mal
notable_quotes.english: My God! What should I do, I have never done evil
notable_quotes.context: After reading of her son Jean's deposition on August 12, 1624

notable_quotes.speaker: Court record
notable_quotes.french: Lesquelles confessions on a tiré d'elle avec beaucoup de peines y ayant apparence a ses deportements et discours que le malin l'assistoit, disant s'il y avoit moyen de faire sortir quelque chose d'elle qui l'empeschoit de dire la verité, et ceux qui estoient au sabat avec elle
notable_quotes.english: Which confessions were drawn from her with great difficulty, there being appearance in her behavior and speech that the evil one was assisting her, saying if there was a way to get something out of her that prevented her from telling the truth, and those who were at the sabbat with her
notable_quotes.context: Description of difficulty extracting confession from accused on August 12, 1624

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Colombain (accused)
notable_quotes.french: le diable Sorpy leur faisoit de belles promesses mais que c'est un trompeur, qu'ils y dancoient et banquettoient et faisoient des choses qui ne valoient guiere
notable_quotes.english: the devil Sorpy made them beautiful promises but he is a deceiver, that they danced and banqueted there and did things that were not worth much
notable_quotes.context: Confession after being given holy water on August 12, 1624

relationships.evidence_text: Admitted taking Jean and his sisters Claire and Mongeotte to sabat
Admitted taking Jean and his sisters Claire and Mongeotte to sabat
had been seduced during lifetime of mother-in-law; previously accused by her mother-in-law Chretienne
Her son Jean, aged 12, had told his daughter Claudine, 10, as they were guarding animals
two cows belonging to his sister Marie
his wife, who came from la Bresse
his father caught her stealing wood
Royne femme Remy Martin; her husband Remy Martin

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over animal trespassing (Remy Martin found 2 of her cows in his field). Refusal to lend horses/property (Remy Choffel refused to lend her a horse, then a mare). Theft of wood from hedge (caught by Nicolas Barthremin le viel). Suspicion of taking milk from cows (Remy Claude and servants suspected her). Dispute over butter-making inability. General pattern of resource conflicts in community.

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Marie turned her away from veillée, saying there was no more space
refused to lend her a horse, she said he was 'un pauvre homme' to refuse such a small thing

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: father caught her stealing wood from hedge, took her to house of Nicolas Villaume as witness; she said they would repent

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: asked another woman why they were not taking accused to Arches along with Mengeotte Bourgman; she heard this and went off angrily, muttering and shaking her head

harms_catalog.harm_description: could not eat, drink, or rest for a year

harms_catalog.victim_name: animals belonging to Remy Demenge Parmentier
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: she had been in his house one morning, although no quarrel

harms_catalog.victim_name: horse belonging to Jean Mongin dit Haxat

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: met Nicolas and Jean Colombain on road; Nicolas said they wanted witness to bring his son to testify against them

multiple animal deaths causing economic loss

Easter - when Jean became angry with children and wolf carried off goat
confirmation mentioned - accused confirmed after initial seduction, did not see devil for 7 years

prior_legal_disputes.description: Caught stealing wood from hedge by Nicolas Barthremin le viel; taken to house of Nicolas Villaume as witness
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: beaten with stick and handle of axe; called witch

prior_legal_disputes.description: Called witch by Bastien Houat when their children quarrelled; called witch by Nicolas Barthremin
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: did not react or seek legal redress

prior_legal_disputes.description: Accused said she had been to Arches already (15 years earlier?) and returned as 'femme de bien'

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Son Jean was interrogated and offered food (white bread, meat, parsnips) during questioning; told his family they wanted to hang him with leather strap to make him talk

hearsay_chains.content: father had wanted to marry her, but was discouraged by friends who said her mother from Bresse was already suspected
Jean told her what his mother had instructed about not talking to interrogators

hearsay_chains.source: his wife who came from la Bresse
hearsay_chains.content: her mother was already reputed witch there
he went to sabbat with his mother and danced
he had been to the sabbat with her
they suspected her of taking milk from his cows
wife consulted diviner who said they knew who had turned back the mare
talk of going to sabbat, eating black flesh, getting money; Royne veuve Jean des Thiales of Remonchamp was there
how Jean had threatened to kill him and make him eat rotten meat
whole family went to sabbat except little girl who could not walk; details about black meat, black horse, money

hearsay_chains.source: Jean told him and other boys
hearsay_chains.content: went to sabbat with mother; father went to get money on little black horse in menaprey; mother said not to tell others
if she feared someone she should get her to come to house, or obtain something from her
extensive details about sabbat - house of iron/fire, cooking meat and millet, big black men, dancing, poorly cooked meat

hearsay_chains.source: Jean told her and her sister Mongeon same morning
hearsay_chains.content: what happened during his interrogation the day before - given white bread, meat, parsnips; threatened with hanging; father promised him clothes; instructed not to drink wine or say dredard
followed by attack on goat by wolf; Jean talked about father going to get money
threat to kill son of Jean Demenge; claim he could use salt to take milk from cows

after reading son's deposition said 'Mon dieu! Que dois-je faire, jamais je n'ay faict mal'

third_parties.name: Mongeotte (daughter of accused)

third_parties.name: Romain Thiebault

third_parties.name: Arnoult Martin
third_parties.context: Accused said she had not seen him at sabbat but would willingly have denounced him since he had offended them

third_parties.name: Remiere fille de Richard
third_parties.context: Accused said she did not know her, that her son might have been mistaken as devil takes various figures

third_parties.name: Remy Claude
third_parties.context: He and his servants suspected accused of taking milk from his cows

third_parties.name: gruyer's son

third_parties.name: Bastien Houat's late father
third_parties.context: Had wanted to marry accused but was discouraged by friends who said her mother from Bresse was already suspected

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an extraordinarily detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony, particularly from children who repeated stories told by the accused's son Jean (age 12). The trial demonstrates significant use of child testimony (at least 7 child witnesses ages 9-18), hearsay evidence about sabbat attendance, and multiple allegations of maleficia following quarrels. Notable features include: (1) Jean's detailed descriptions of sabbat to other children; (2) his mother's instructions not to talk during interrogation; (3) allegations of weather magic ('dredard'); (4) pattern of animal deaths following quarrels; (5) confession obtained after clerical intervention, not torture initially; (6) devil transformation into wolf; (7) extensive use of holy water and blessed candles during interrogation; (8) accused ultimately only charged her son under torture. The record provides exceptional insight into community fears, children's role in witch trials, and interrogation techniques. Costs detailed: 55 francs for prévôt, 385 francs for court at Arches.
